categories.table_doc: Contains a list of the categories to which listings might belong. The `rowid` is the id of the category.

data_doc: Combined, cross-referenced data for the Agora marketplace. This should be the final stop of Agora data, before it goes on to be combined with other markets.

listings.amount: The total amount of each unit of this listing. For example, if the listing is `200 g cocaine`, then `amount` is 200. If an amount was not found, this defaults to 0.
listings.category: The id of the category to which this belongs. See table `categories` for a complete listing of categories by id.

listings.quantity: The total quantity of this listing on sale. For example, if the listing is `100 pills of 200 mg XTC`, then quantity is 100. (Compare to column `amount`, which here would be 200.)
listings.ships_from: The id of the location which this ships from. See column `ships_from` for a complete listing.
listings.ships_to: The id of the location which this ships to. See column `ships_to` for a complete listing.
listings.table_doc: Each row of this table corresponds to a single listing, by title. For example, a listing might be `100 pills of 200 mg XTC`. It contains data on the amount and quantity of the good on sale, as well as various characteristics of the good, such as its shipping location. Many observations of a single listing were taken over time, but each listing only has one row in this table. See the table `prices` and `reviews` for time dependent data
listings.title: The name of this listing.
listings.units: The units in which this listing is measured, e.g., `g` for grams. Empty (or null) if no units found.
listings.vendor: The id of the vendor who offers this listing. See `vendors` for a complete listing of vendors.

prices.dat: The date at which this price was observed, in days since 1970.
prices.listing: The id of the listing to which this price belongs.
prices.max_sales: The upper number of sales the vendor offering the listing to which this price belongs had made, at the time this price was scraped.
prices.min_sales: The lower number of sales the vendor offering the listing to which this price belongs had made, at the time this price was scraped.
prices.net_reviews: The total number of reviews observed up to and including the date at which this listing was scraped.
prices.net_reviews_smooth: A smooth spline fitted to the reviews.
prices.price: The price of the listing, in USD.
prices.rating: The aggregate rating of the vendor offering the listing to which this price belongs, at the time it was scraped. It ranges from 0 to 5.
prices.reviews_average_month: Average number of new reviews received, per day, over the next month, for this listing.
prices.reviews_average_week: Average number of new reviews received, per day, over the next week, for this listing.
prices.reviews_per_day: Estimate of the number of reviews this listing was receiving per day at the time this listing was scraped.
prices.table_doc: A complete listing of all price, sales, and rating observations for each listing. The name `prices` is a misnomer, and should be changed, since this table also contains seller characteristics as well.
prices.vendor: The id of the vendor who offers this listing. See `vendors` for a complete listing of vendors.

reviews.dat: The date at which this review was LEFT, in DAYS since 1970.
reviews.listing: The id of the listing to which this review belongs.

reviews.scraped_at: The date at which this review was SCRAPED, in DAYS since 1970.
reviews.table_doc: A complete listing of all reviews for each listing.
reviews.user_max_sales: An upper bound on the number of transactions made by the user who left this review.
reviews.user_min_sales: A lower bound on the number of transactions made by the user who left this review.
reviews.user_rating: The average rating of the user who left this review.
reviews.val: The actual review value, from 0 to 5.
reviews.vendor: The id of the vendor to whom the listing for which this review was left belongs.
